channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report E-2024030318
item.description:
Report E-2024030318

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-20T15:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-05
  • City: FALCONER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver was at another delivery making a delivery when he noticed a shipment of pails on his truck slightly leaning. In a proactive measure, the driver decided to take the shipment off the truck at the current customer he was at to restack and stretch wrap it before something bad happened. When taking the shipment off of his trailer when he was crossing the dockplate with the shipment three pails fell off of the pallet contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was contained and confined and an outside response company was called in to help cleanup and remediate.

item.title: Report X-2024030464
item.description:
Report X-2024030464

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-19T15:11:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: NEWBURGH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA WAS CALLED TO THE TRAILER TO CHECK ON LEAKING PACKAGE UPON FURTHER INSPECTION QA REMOVED THE PACKAGE FROM TRAILER AND STARTED TO PROCESS THE DAMAGED HAZMAT DescribePack: THE 2 OUT OF THE 4 BOTTLES INSIDE HAD LOOSE CAPS WHICH CAUSED THE LIQUID TO LEAKOUT AND DAMAGE THE BOX THAT WAS HOLDING THE BOTTLES INSIDE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS REMOVED FROM THE TRAILER AND REPACKED IN A SALVAGE DRUM WHILE DAMAGE REPORTS WAS BEING DONE

item.title: Report X-2024030438
item.description:
Report X-2024030438

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: LONG ISLAND CITY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The drum was being loaded onto an outbound trailer when it was dropped. It was secured by the lid and sent to quality control personnel. DescribePack: The lid on the drum was loosen and not tight enough to secure transport. Leakage would certainly occur upon transfer. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Kitty litter was placed to prevent the spread of leakage and prevent injury.

item.title: Report X-2024021925
item.description:
Report X-2024021925

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-09
  • City: JAMAICA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On2/9/2024 at approximately 1730, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 4009660 at the station location in Jamaica, NY, reporting a corrosive spill. The shipment consists of 3 fiberboard boxes, each marked as "Excepted Quaniities" and each containing a cylinder. One of the boxes leaked during transport. Further inspection revealed that the closure appeared bent, resulting in spillage. Upon obtaining the UN classification of the Hazard class 8 substance from the shipper, it was determined that the commodity may have exceeded the maximum allowable amount for excepted quantities, according to IATA Regulations. An estimated 4000 mL of liquid was discovered in each cylinder. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2024030183
item.description:
Report X-2024030183

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-20
  • City: EAST ELMHURST
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package had arrived to our station in a damp state. QA and management team isolated the package due to potential damage. Upon inspection, it appears that their are 4 bottles of hydrogen peroxide that had loose caps and inadequate inner packaging for transportation. This caused the contents to spill in the fiberboard box. DescribePack: Package failure was due to the hydrogen peroxide bottles having loose caps and inadequate inner packaging for transportation. This caused a spill at the bottom of the fiberboard box. The spilled contents stayed within the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Management team placed clear bags and absorbent pads around the leaking package. After the spill was contained, management team placed the damaged HazMat inside of a red HazMat bin and placed the package inside of the HazMat cage for further processing.

item.title: Report X-2024030203
item.description:
Report X-2024030203

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-13
  • City: MASPETH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was being off loaded from a trailer when it was dropped, and it landed upside down causing the tops of the containers to come loose and cause a slow leak from the containers. DescribePack: The tops of the containers are loose, and the box shows signs of a slow leak from the contents inside the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: When the package was discovered to be leaking the package was placed inside a hazmat tote and was placed inside the hazmat cage. Most of the liquid was confined to the box and ant liquid that came out was absorbed by cardboard that was placed down.
